sentences.sContent: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.sCn: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

sentences.sContent: ...Panini’s Ancient Rome and Modem Rome represent the sights most prized...
...the "Mona Lisa" came to represent Western culture itself...
...The two themes respectively represent the life ideal of Confucianism and Taoism...

synos.tran: 代表；表现；描绘；回忆；再赠送

remMethod.val: re ＋ present(出席) → 作为…的代表， 象征

words.tran: 典型的，有代表性的；代议制的
能被代表的；能上演的；能被描绘的

trans.tranCn: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
trans.tranOther: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people
